newsitem.title: UK: Staffware says '96 to dip below expectations.
newsitem.headline: Staffware says '96 to dip below expectations.

text.p: British recruitment firm Staffware Plc said on Thursday that it did not expect its 1996 profits to meet market expectations although it anticipated a strong growth in business in 1997 and after that.
"The board remains confident in the trading outlook and growth for 1997 but does not now expect the company's profits for 1996 to reach market estimates," Staffware said in a statement.
The company said it had a strong performance in Europe but its additional investments in the United States were yet to achieve the expected results.
"The shortfall in the U.S., together with some other anticipated orders falling into the new fianncial year, will adversely effect 1996 profits.
Staffware incurred expenses on its staff recruitment programme and also on an abortive acquisition of CSE in Austria, which it said would have an impact on its second half profits.
The stock was quoted down 40p at 213-1/2 by 0804 GMT.
